newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech farm min says state to buy all wheat - CTK.
newsitem.headline: Czech farm min says state to buy all wheat - CTK.

text.p: The Czech State Fund for Market Regulation will buy all consumable wheat from the country's 1996 harvest and will be the only body allowed to export wheat from the Czech Republic, the local news agency CTK quoted Agriculture Minister Josef Lux as saying.
The fund has been controlling roughly one third of the domestic grain market in the past years.
This year it set a price it buys wheat from farmers at 3,500 crowns per tonne, with a possibility of paying additional supplements if the fund manages to sell it to the mills at a higher price.
CTK quoted Lux, speaking in the southern town of Hluboka nad Vltavou, as saying that the additional supplement would range between 500 and 1,000 crowns.
Czech farmers have called for higher prices of wheat, saying their costs have grown.
